name: openSUSE Leap 15.6
install_guide_markdown:
# openSUSE Leap 15.6 Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 2GB RAM minimum (4GB recommended)
- 20GB disk space
- USB drive (2GB+) for installer

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get NET or DVD version from opensuse.org

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use Etcher or similar tool to write ISO to USB

## Step 3: Boot from USB
Restart computer and select USB from boot menu

## Step 4: Install openSUSE
Follow YaST installer prompts for partitioning and configuration

## Step 5: Complete Setup
Reboot and configure user accounts and system settings

install_steps.title: Download openSUSE Leap ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Choose NET (650MB, requires internet) or DVD (4.7GB, offline installation)

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB
install_steps.detail_md:
Use Etcher, Rufus, or dd to write ISO:
```
sudo dd if=openSUSE-Leap-15.6-DVD-x86_64.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```

install_steps.title: Boot from USB
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB and restart computer. Access boot menu (F12, F2, or DEL) and select USB device.

install_steps.title: Run YaST Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Follow YaST (Yet another SysConfig Tool) installer for language, timezone, partitioning, and software selection.

install_steps.title: Create User Account
install_steps.detail_md: Set root password and create regular user account with specified username and password.

install_steps.title: Complete Installation
install_steps.detail_md: Review settings summary and click Install to finalize. System will reboot when complete.
